Reviews.Title: A consumer's take on upgrading to 3D, 55', and LED
Reviews.Author: richfallatjr
Reviews.Content: My first and only flat-screen was a 40' Samsung LN40A550P3F before purchasing the  55' Sony Bravia HX750.  The reviews were pretty lacking so I've decided to make this review detailed as possible from a consumer's point of view.The main features that sold me on this set was the 55' size, 3D capability, picture quality, and built in Wi-Fi.  Three lived up to and surpassed expectations while one is a disappointment.Size upgrade makes a world of difference but hinders streaming experienceThe 55 inch HX750 dwarfs the old 40 inch Samsung.  The television doubles as living room PC monitor and I was constantly having to squint and crank up the font sizes in order to read while sitting on the couch.  The 55 inch screen size allows me to sit back and relax with a wireless keyboard as if I'm seated at the desk.Blurays look phenomenal on the large screen and bigger is better when it comes to immersing yourself in the 3D experience.  I recently axed cable from our household as I was beginning to believe HD streaming was providing good enough quality to watch on the big screen.  However, the artifacts present in the compressed streaming video is magnified greatly.  Pixelation and banding that was only slightly visible on the 40 inch Samsung is now a distraction while watching on the large 55 inch screen.While watching on the larger screen makes for a cinematic experience, it also exposes flaws of streaming video compression.  Looks like I'll be switching back to multiple Netflix rentals, Redbox, and Cable if boosting my internet bandwidth doesn't improve streaming quality.Is this 3D thing going to die fast?I've watched several movies in the theater and thought 3D added to the experience.  I had my doubts an in-home television could deliver experiences anywhere close to cinema quality.  I also purchased the Sony 3D Bundle/Narnia Glasses (wish glasses were included for the price).I popped in "Chronicles of Narnia Legend of the Dawn Treader", A Very Harold & Kumar Christmas (Two-Disc Blu-ray 3D / Blu-ray / DVD / UltraViolet Digital Copy), and Batman: Arkham City for Playstation 3.Playing my fist video game in 3D was like listening to a CD for the first time.  The Narnia movie, something I normally wouldn't give a chance, had me completely immersed.  The imagery looked beautiful, added so much punch, I never wanted to take my eyes off the screen.  One of the drawback of young technology is there are barely any titles available.  Was really disappointed that I couldn't purchase Avatar 3D without buying a Panasonic BD player.Another surprise was the Simulated 3D setting that tries to emulate the stereo depth on normal footage.  While not perfect, or anywhere close to a 3D movie, the Simulated 3D added pop to the picture.  I actually preferred wearing glasses, because the colors on the Standard setting looked more natural.  It also helped to direct the eye to focal points, especially when shallow depth of field was utilized.I don't believe 3D is going away folks so "adapt or die" (quote stolen from "Moneyball" which looked great on the HX750)AudioCan't complain, sounds great in comparison to the old Samsung which has mediocre sound quality.  Was really loud with the bar cranked a little over half way.Picture QualityOverall I believe the picture looks great with a couple of tweaks from the default settings.  One of the first things I did was disabled the Motion Flow and Cinema Flow settings.  The 240Hz frame interpolation gag that i am not a big fan of.  Colors are vibrant and the image is sharp.Since this is an LED, there is some visible light vignetting around the corners and a light leak running along the bottom of the frame.  It's most noticeable while watching in a dark room.  I'm not sure if this issue creeps up in plasmas or higher end LED models, but it's definitely not a plus.  I can live with it though. Default `Standard' color calibrated for 3DI was really on the fence about buying the HX750 given the reviews on extremely poor black-levels.  Now, I am no expert when it comes to judging picture quality, but here is my take.On many of the low-lit scenes, dark areas do appear lifted and have a bluish magenta cast over it.  However, there are still deep black to be found.  I've noticed throughout viewing and on certain end title sequences, the blacks almost match the surrounding frame.  It seems to me that the values are gamma'd up, essentially crushing the dark shadow valued details.  Anything that isn't quite pure black.  This is problematic because it's somewhat of a golden rule in color correction not to go complete 0 black.3D glasses alleviate black level and magenta cast issuesIt's my impression that Sony decided to calibrate the default color to look best while the glasses are on.  I'm viewing through 3D Active Glasses.  When powered up, the overall picture value gets knocked down around a full stop, making the `darks' richer.  Also, the bluish magenta color is completely neutralized.Considering the fact Sony has so much invested in Blu Ray and 3D televisions, it only makes sense that they would tailor the best experience to that viewing mode.  People love the 3D, they tell their friends, and their friends buy a Sony 3D TV.What I didn't like so much Apps and Wi-FiNetflix, Amazon On-Demand, Hulu, Youtube, and more.  These pre-installed apps were a draw when shopping for a new flatscreen, and I was in particularly excited that the HX750 included built in Wi-Fi and Youtube.  Most of the Apps are contained in a Sony wrapper layout design and look very similar.  No flashy animations like competitors (even under the same brand) much more utilitarian.Sadly, these are lacking implementations of Netflix, Amazon, Twitter, and Youtube.  Really scratching my head as to why they didn't employ similar navigation and style the PS3 counterparts.  I assume it was to unify the apps more, but it is much less intuitive, and makes for a somewhat painful user experience.Observations of AppsNetflix  No ratings displayed by media icons  Cannot rate media  No search memory or smart searchAmazon On Demand  No watch recently list (huge bummer)  No search memory or smart searchYoutube  Subscriptions buried in menu  Subscription pages don't always display with latest first (really?)  I like how videos play in small view while searchingSlacker  Cannot log into existing accountsFacebook  Not bad but the layout is a bit wasteful.  Only displays a few posts.Twitter  Cannot follow linksWi-Fi signal is slower than other devicesMy current setup includes the HX750 on a wall mount, PS3, and a Dell PC all within a couple feet of one and other.  The speed of the connection on the HX750 is about 1/4 to 1/2 that of the other devices.  The internet speed of my ISP is anywhere from 6.5-10 Mbps.  Also, the entertainment center is a pretty far distance from the router.Not a racehorse setup by any stretch, but streaming video content on the Sony HX750 is UNWATCHABLE 9 times out of 10 with long and constant loading icons or Network Timeout errors.  What adds to the aggravation, is it completely freezes if one attempts to navigate away from the `loading' page.  Controller button clicks will not respond until the internet searching finally errors out or finishes thinking.Other devices in the vicinity work fine and load HD most of the time.  I'm wondering if there is a hardware issue or if the mount is somehow blocking the internal antennae, but I doubt that.  It would be such a pain to box this big thing up and return it because of bad Wi-Fi connection issues, and considering I already have the PC and PS3 connected, it might not be completely necessary.  I will wait to see if others are having similar issues and contact Technical Support before lugging it back to the store.  Also, plan to upgrade ISP to FIOS and will update if this helps the issues.Let's hope Sony corrects the App and Wi-Fi issues via firmware updates because it would be a shame releasing unpolished extras in a device that costs around $2000.  Especially when similar applications already have a strong foundation on the PS3.  Dealing with anything Wi-Fi related on the HX750, reminds me of working on a 5 year old computer that doesn't quite have the juice to keep up with the technology.  However, I'll withhold judgement until I see it operate with faster internet.For more reviews like this or if you have any questions visit [...]

Reviews.Title: Faulty t.v., poor response from Sony
Reviews.Author: JDo
Reviews.Content: Well, we bought this t.v. in early April and by the end of May, it stopped working.  It was wonderful when it worked, but died within 2 months.  Quick calls to Sony revealed this is a common problem they're having with this t.v. and they said we need to replace the circuit board.  We waited a couple days before a person from their local service facility called.  That person informed us they didn't have the board in-stock and it would be 4-7 days.  Well, we're still waiting.  They have not been in-touch, we don't know what the hold up is.  We have to chase them constantly to find out what's going on.  Meanwhile, our t.v. still doesn't work.  (When we try to turn it on, it goes immediately to standby mode.)  Soooo disappointed that we shelled out this kind of money for a t.v. that is faulty and Sony isn't particularly motivated to get us up and running again.

Reviews.Title: Sony rules
Reviews.Author: Ron F
Reviews.Content: You are not going to get a MIT review from me.  I waited for a few months for the release and then purchased the 55 inch when it became available.  All I did was plug in the TV without making one adjustment.  Every friend that watches this TV with me rates it a 5.  The 3D is perfect for the living room - don't expect IMAX 3D.  The TV is now $200 cheaper to buy and I really don't care because I am more than pleased with the quality.  HD viewing on this TV is fantastic.  The picture on some of my weekly episodes is so clear that it appears you are sitting next to the actors.  It is a very strange experience to describe because the picture is so amazing.  For the price, pony up - you won't be sorry.P.S.  Bought TV from Amazon.  Not one complaint.  The delivery guys setup the TV and took the box with them.  Also bought the 4 year warranty because of my past experiences with other TVs.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Rcommander "Rcom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for relatively cheap at $1200 shipped to the door including taxes, so my review takes that into account as well.1. The good: This TV has a lot to offer, like the LGs and Samsungs it also has the 2d to 3D button that will give some depth to 2D picture. The TV is light, and thin...plenty bright for a living room with lots of windows. Sound is awesome. It supports HDMI ARC which allows it to control certain home theater equipment automatically which is totally awesome. However you do need to buy a special HDMI 1.4b cable Mediabridge Ultra Series - High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet 6 Feet Category 2 Certified - Supports 3D and Audio Return Channel <-- this one worked great for me, and it was cheap. Sound wise the TV is great but i still paired it up with a small system.Mounting: the TV that I got did not include the base in the box, sony swore up and down to get it to me, but had a back order of 1-2 weeks. I chose to just get a wall mount and mount the TV. The OmniBasics wall mount i got that had a swivel arm, does not fit the TV perfectly because the TV's VESA mounts are made for rails to handle TILT stands, but its ok It fits with the arms showing a little bit on the bottom. But I thought Oh well it can swivel in and out and I am happy.The 3D glasses look awesome, they are almost stylish... and 5 minutes of charge is all it needs for a whole 3 hour movie.2. The bad: The Sony Entertainment Network or all the apps that make this TV fun is a very sluggish interface. I ended up just attaching my old ROKU XD which works a lot better. It says Motionflow XR 480. but NO its not a 480hz tv, its only 240hz but still is better than most 120hz and with the price I got, I am happy.Additional 3D active shutter glasses are very expensive. The Menu system is not easy like my Philips TVs or LG TVs. Sony makes great hardware but besides PS3 they don't have good software or GUI development folks.Tech support for Sony is off-shore, hence, not very good. While I don't mind someone in any part of the world helping me, I do take issue when I have to repeat my issues, name and phone number over 4 times to get the rep to understand me on top of when I am already frustrated with a missing part in the box (the stand or base of TV).3. The ugly: There really is isn't any so far.Other thoughts: The energy label says the TV uses $14 of electricity in the US for a whole year, which is awesome.UPDATE: 1-month later still no stand from Sony after being promised overnight shipping several times. I just ended up mounting tv on the wall. Tv is awesome for gaming on my PS3 as well. Blu-rays look awesome!

Reviews.Title: A good tv but not for sports..
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I must say that I am looking for a very good LED TV since I am one of those unfortunate few that can see Plasma flicker a mile away.  I bought this TV after having returned a Panasonic GT50. This set's picture is not as good as the GT50 but I expected as much.  The TV actually performed better than I expected with BluRay Movies as well as normal content from DirecTV etc etc.  My big issue came with sports.  I have to say watching football was horrible on this set.  I tried all kinds of settings to no avail.  Although I actually like the soap opera effect, I know to turn it off when watching fast action sports like soccer and football.  Tried it with every setting on and off.  Just very disappointing and downright embarrassing.  I ended up returning this set and will purchase the HX850 and am hoping sports viewing will be better.  All reviews indicate that the HX850 is much much better - just wish I didn't have to spend so much more.  Wish me luck!As for Amazon - I purchase everything from Amazon and will continue to do so.  Being able to return a TV within the 30 day period gives you the ability to seek perfection.  Amazon gets 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: I'm picky...and mostly satisfied
Reviews.Author: Roger Maxwell
Reviews.Content: I came from a 2006 LG 42" LCD, so I'm impressed with this Sony. I never had any problems with the old LG, which had an excellent viewing angle. Being one of the earlier LCDs, it had very poor black levels in anything less than a brightly lit room. The Sony has a very faint blue/purple/gray glow during very dark scenes in a very dark room, but it's more than acceptable and orders or magnitude better than my old LG - not as good as plasma, but very acceptable for an LCD. The backlighting is very even with only a hint of vignetting at the very top during solid white backgrounds. I left all settings at factory default except I turned off all the "trick" video processing features such as MotionFlow. It's very smooth and lifelike -- almost like looking through a 55" window, but I don't like the artificial "soap opera" effect. The 3D performance is good, but not excellent. Like most current 3D TVs, there is a bit of flicker that I am very sensitive to. Good effect, though. I didn't buy the TV for 3D - I bought it based on screen size, price, brand, and LED backlighting. There are TONS of built-in goodies like a web browser (that doesn't seem to work very well), which I don't use. So far, I'm satisfied with my purchase. I could have got it cheaper through Amazon.com, but ended up picking one up at a local retailer since it came with a free Sony BDP-S590 3D Blu-Ray player at the time.

Reviews.Author: vkan "vkan"
Reviews.Content: simple this sony tv is crystal clear/ and 3d are amazing good applicationsony never compromise in quality no one can close to this tv its good as all in simple word , my kids enjoy everyday and sony entertainment app is awesome. best tv i ever had . i have in my home all samsung lcd tv in every room this is my first sony tv but its really worth it of my money..go sony HX750

Reviews.Title: Blu ray Conquistador
Reviews.Author: Armando
Reviews.Content: Purchased TV on 12/28 for $1,498.00, I currently own and matched this TV vs my Samsung PNA50A550 Plasma.*The pre-setting is not for me and you should set the settings to your personal preference.I calibritated my TV to my personal preference. If you have it and want to give it a shot: let me know and I'll give you the settings that I use.Cons: This TV is not for channel flippers or day-to-day viewing due to different picture signals coming from each, example: ESPN,NBC NEWS,ABC,NFL Network etc. Viewing angle is limited. Blacks are not "inky". The best format is probably 'Custom', with a 'Warm 1' tone w/ 'Smooth'. You'll then enjoy the day to day channels better. Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge channel flipper and as long as you have the settings right, each "HD" is a masterpiece, it's the un-HD channels that lack character. My Plasma has the deeper tones of color vs the Sony's bright colors. I'm picky, so I see the difference.Pros: This TV truly shines on HD & Blu Ray movies. You literally feel like you are watching these folks as if you were on the set. This is the #1 reason why I demoted my Plasma to the bedroom. I am a big fan of the "soap opera effect". I buy an HD TV for optimal resolution and and if I didn't want the best within my budget, then I'd be buying a tube television circa 95' for pennies. You can bring out the black tones by adjusting the settings and even though it'll still lack behind a plasma set, the black is realistic vs just "inky".Sound: What sound? Kidding. I don't use it. I have the Klipsch Icon SB1 Sound Bar and Wireless Sub to do the heavy lifting.Internet: I successfuly synced with ease: Pandora and Youtube. I enjoy Amazon Prime for my movies, also synced with ease. As for the other internet options: I haven't took the time to wander out yet. I didn't buy this TV because it's "smart". I bought it to enjoy the best cinematic experience I could get with my budget of $1,700.00. (with tax)3D: I haven't tried it. I didn't buy the glasses. I didn't buy this TV for the 3D effect being that I believe we still have years before we see true HD 3D. (I may update this comment down the road and I'll eat my words then.)My thought: I love my Plasma and frankly, it's as great as it was when it first came out of the box. I can watch my Plasma from any angle. The blacks are rediculously deep. I calibrated it to my personal preference and it will bring the pop when needed from: SPORTS, MOVIES, Day-to-Day viewing. I'd rate my plasma higher on everything except movies. Even though the resolution on the PLASMA is clear as day and bright as can be, you will never feel like you are in the movie. You will always have that feeling that there is glass between you and the action. *Yes, I know there is literally glass between us, that's not my point. I seriously considered a bargain LCD TV being that: WIFI, and 3D weren't my goals. But just like any other person, it's good to know that I have it if I want it. Buy this set if you want to see movies at their best along with any HD programming. Tweak it to your preference and you will not be disapointed. I now enjoy the best of two worlds in the privacy of my home. If I want to be in a channel flipping mode, I go into my bedroom and watch my 50' Plasma. When it's time to watch "The Dark Knight Rises", then it's time for this bad boy to perform.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia is Unmatched
Reviews.Author: Michael E Bee
Reviews.Content: TV was easy to set up and has an awesome picture. The quality is worth paying for as you will be amazed by the clarity and colors

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Internet ok
Reviews.Author: Big Dave "Big Dave"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV direct from Sony as a discounted replacement for a Wega with an optical block issue.  The picture is amazing - shows well in both dark and bright room conditions, scene choices (cinema, sports, etc) made it easy to set up TV based on content.  There's calibration settings out on the web, but there's really very little adjustments needed out of the box for a great picture.Only complaint is that the wi-fi receiver is very weak.  I have a Sony Bluray under the TV that is on my wireless network, but the TV couldn't find it or connect.  I have Ethernet going to my Directv box, I just added a $20 Ethernet switch/hub to get another port and connected via the LAN jack in the back of the TV.  Netflix streaming is HD quality now, what an improvement over the Wi service I had before.I was concerned about sound quality since the thin LED edge lit sets have small speakers, but it's fine for everyday use.  I have a home theater system for films.  If you don't have one, you might consider a sound bar for some bass response just be aware  the TV sits low on the stand and most sound bars will block the bottom of the screen.  If its wall mounted, no problem.Lastly, the 3-d quality is excellent, only complaint is that no 3d glasses come with the set - they are about $50 each.

Reviews.Title: Great 240Hz TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I did my research on this TV before I purchased it.  Yes, it wasn't the top rated television, but it suits me just fine!  I watched the Avengers on Blu-Ray last night and the picture was GORGEOUS! Apple TV looks great on here as well. Most of the reviews are correct when describing the blacks are not as dark as I had hoped, but honestly, it's minimal.Out of the box setup was easy the on screen menus are great.  The Wifi on the TV works well.  I was actually able to download the Sony Media Remote app for my iPhone and I can control my TV with it. I also dig the Track ID button on the remote.  If I hear any music that is currently playing on the TV, I just hit the button and it tells me the name of the song and who the artist is.Overall, I'm very happy with the TV and would make the purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything that I wanted in a tv. The picture quality is very good.  I highly recommend doing a sound bar of some sort. Sound is just ok, but I have not seen a tv I wouldn't recommend a sound bar for.  It is worth the extra money.  I really like the Sony app for the DROID.  If you want to do any kind of You Tube search that requires typing, you will not want to use the Sony supplied remote. I can type my search in with my DROID and search all day long.  I haven't tried the 3D out, since mine did not come with supplied 3D glasses.  My deal came with a sound bar instead.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality 3D TV at a decent price
Reviews.Author: KA
Reviews.Content: I watched the price on this TV for a while when planning to upgrade from a 40 inch Sony. I have to admit I have a significant amount of brand loyalty to Sony, but with how many positive comments I received about the picture quality of my older 40 inch Bravia LCD, I was set on going with either Sony or Panasonic for the size upgrade. I was fairly against paying over 2,000 for a new TV so I was pleased when I saw the price drop significantly. I picked it up and it has met all of my expectations except one. It is thinner and has a smaller bezel than a large amount of TVs I have interacted with. The bezel is nice with its glossy finish. I think the picture quality is great although I do calibrate my TV with a test pattern disc. It is able to reproduce nice colors so that when watching football the team colors are as you know they should be and the orange if the first down markers are correctly vivid but dont lose their detail in over-saturation. The picture is clear and Blurays are delightful to watch. I picked up 4 pairs of the Playstation branded glasses to use with this and the 3D effect was great when we watched Prometheus. I was interested to see that when watching 3D content on a home display such as this, the content sinks back into the screen with extra depth rather than popping out at you like in the theaters. All in all everyone was impressed with the 3D including myself. The TV has performed wonderfully and I am very pleased. The one exception is that the blacks are most definitely greys. I honestly have never understood how a TV could replicate a black darker than its screen blackness, but it is something that my last LCD did better than this one as it was quite apparent to me that the blacks were lacking in their darkness. Perhaps I could adjust it with the settings, but according to the test patterns, I have everything set correctly. None the less, I am most certain that nobody other than me notices this at all, so it doesnt bother me too much. I would certainly recommend this to anyone interested in a quality 3D TV that doesnt cost over $2,000.

Reviews.Title: Great Pic, Smart capabilities almose useless
Reviews.Author: AdLiah
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as an open item for $1000 and as far as similarly priced TVs I think I did about as good as I could have for the money.  The picture is amazing and I am completely satisfied with the performance of HD and 3D, however, I see why this set was returned.  I was really interested in getting a smart TV so that I could move my PS3 to a different set and use Netflix directly off the TV.  Too bad the smart functions are virtually unusable.  The apps and interface are extremely sluggish and Netflix browsing is way too frustrating to use.  I push the scroll right button and it doesn't do anything, I try again thinking maybe it didn't get the signal and it still sits.  About 15 seconds later it will finally respond and scroll over 2 times because apparently both pushes of the remote button registered, but it took forever to actually do it.  So yea, the PS3 will have to stay hooked up to this TV until I get a smart box for it.  Overall I am still happy since it does everything I really NEED a TV to do, but it's still disappointing since I have been wanting a smart TV for a long time and now that I finally have one I can't use those functions.  4 stars just based off the deal I got.  Had I paid $1399 for the brand new one I would have taken it back.

Reviews.Title: Nice 55" LCD
Reviews.Author: Tzvetan M Chaliavski
Reviews.Content: I like it.The TV is everything I thought it would be.The audio coming out of its speakers isn't quite up to the audiophile standards. If you buy this TV you might consider getting external speakers.I tried the 3D glasses and they seem OK.I would have given the TV 5 stars but I have only had it for a month. I will revisit this later and perhaps give it 5 stars. My experience with Sony has been positive so far. I've had other Sony-branded LCDs and I never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: We are happy with Sony TV purchase,
Reviews.Author: Rekha Madhavi Meda "Rekha"
Reviews.Content: Nice purhcase, it's very nice to have Sony smart tv, it has got many features which are still exploring, it's smart tv, if we have some apps installed any smart phone, you can control the tv from your phone, it's amazing

Reviews.Title: Great Price for High Quality
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Manues "C.J."
Reviews.Content: Bought a Sony Blu-ray home theater system to compliment the tv.  Sony's sync tech is amazing, everything was plug and play, either remote will work with either system.  Sony smart phone app works flawlessly as well with both products.

Reviews.Title: Nice 240Hz
Reviews.Author: Douglas McIntyre
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Love the pre-sets for Wi-Fi and internet apps. Easy setup.  Also bought the optional camera for Skyping, which I wish had a zoom feature or more of a zoom lens. Matte finish is nice because I use it in a bright space.

Reviews.Title: So yummy
Reviews.Author: Seattle Shopper
Reviews.Content: Great service from Amazon.  They will set it up for you, although we opted to do that ourselves. It was very easy to get it out of the box.  The biggest thing we did not expect was that we had to secure this really big tv to the wall.  It doesn't just stand up by itself securely - the kittens could have knocked it over.  You can buy an over-priced piece of plastic from Sony that might help.  We wrapped belt-like straps around the tv stand that secured it to the table it sits on and that works well - or you can hang it on the wall, of course.The wifi is heavenly.  Xfinity has great apps for the iPhone and iPad to use to find programs and change the channels.  It is a little tricky to get Amazon Prime working, but if you follow the directions and use a PC to register, it will not take too long.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, great 3D - internet capability sorely lacking
Reviews.Author: Square peg
Reviews.Content: I am a probably a Sony lifer, simply because of the picture quality, and this flat screen is no exception.  Although I could have lived without it, the 3D is pretty amazing and the unit was $200 less expensive then the internet flatscreen TV I was looking at. I can't believe I had to pay extra for the glasses. And they aren't cheap!However, had I known that the wireless and internet would be so lame, I would have bought a cheaper flatscreen.The unit has major weirdness snycing up with the wireless connection.  Sometimes it takes 5 minutes, sometimes it's right away. This is a mystery because it's not my connection speed.  Once it wakes up, streaming Netflix is fine because the service buffers the stream, but YouTube balks continously if you don't reset the picture quality to standard delivery. I gave up on Hulu Plus. I'm not sure if this is a wireless issue, and haven't tried a direct connection yet, but I have two wireless LG blu-ray players with these apps on other TV's and this problem does not manifest itself on either unit. As other users have indicated, the apps are not the same, but they are also different on the blu-ray units. The on-screen keypad and search functions for the apps is really cumbersome and frustrating.  I am going to download Media Remote  - perhaps that will fix some of the usability issues.My biggest disapointment is with the internet "feature". The internet home page is the Sony home page and the tv takes forever to load all the photos. The only way I can get to the internet is through the little Google icon at the top of the page and then I always get an error message before it loads. Worst of all, once again, it loads super slooooow. It may be that there is a secret setup and that I am not in on the secret. Coupled with the problems with using the onscreen keyboard, I usually end up using my laptop or my tablet.They advertise the Sony Entertainment network, but I have tried to sign up a couple of times, and the system is always down.Finally, the remote keys that you use most are squashed together in two concentric circles. I am constantly pressing the home button instead of the down button.

Reviews.Title: after 3 years i hate this tv

Reviews.Content: limited internet, tv guide doesn't work, 3D glassed give you a headach, no keyboard, 3,000 of wasted money, should have done more research.

Reviews.Content: i love my tv. very nice amazing  picture great quality and the 3d is awesome would recommend this tv to all

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL55HX750055-inch TV

Reviews.Content: This is a great tv.  I've been glad i bought this from Day 1.  Great Picture.  Don't know about the TV sound as we use a separate sound system with the tv but it comes out great there.  Haven't tried the 3_D because it think the price of the glasses is too high but i didn't get the TV for the 3-D anyway.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture

Reviews.Content: Set-up for viewing was fast but dialing in best picture took some time. Blu ray looks amazing but dish network even hd channels have too much contrast. I think this issue has to do with the quality of the satellite signal and not the tv.  I am not sure of the tv stand strength in SoCal. It's wobbly to bumps.  Aiming to mount on the wall.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: phcfamily
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv, and would reccommend it to anyone. Another bonus is that the price has gone up by $500, since we got ours, providing us with an unexpectant investment opportunity.

Reviews.Title: colors beautiful--fast respond time-this was a great purchase--Sony are the best T.V on the market!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Donnie Marquez
Reviews.Content: this is a great product--there is so much upgraded technology in the T.V.  colors are bright-- clarity is the best-- a good decision to purchase it. are the Tdg-br250/b rechargeable 3Dglasses  the  right glasses for this T.V

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: Shipped this all the way to Trinidad and it came in good time...this tv is awesome...tv shows great dark colours and brilliant with different lightings during the day and night..haven't use the 3d that much yet...downside was u had to purchase 3d glasses as none came with the tv...but for the price this tv beats all competition in its class...

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dan Scupin
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase.  The delivery company brought it upstairs, opened it and connected it to TV input, turned it on and made sure it worked and we both inspected it for damage (there was none)  I'm impressed with the price and quality.  Surprised to see that the price of the TV had actually increased since I purchased it ,maybe I bought it on some type of special sale.

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV
Reviews.Author: HappyCustomer
Reviews.Content: This TV has been pretty good.  I have the 55 in which is as large as this model goes I believe.  The only knock so far has been the smart TV interface can lag a bit, but overall the picture has been amazing.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: Pesky
Reviews.Content: So far we love our new TV! Great picture and streaming capabilities. Makes old movies look great too..Hopefully it will last for years.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL55HX750 TV - A Wounderful Set
Reviews.Author: John Olmstead
Reviews.Content: TV arrived on time and the delivery person was very helping getting it in the house and testing the unit. We researched a lot of TVs using Amazon's excellent reviews and tools and decided on this TV. (Sony). Many of the flat panels that we have seen in other people's homes often appeared distorted, people looked fat and the colors not true. Not so with this Sony - picture quality is beautiful - no distortion, people are correctly proportioned and the colors are rich and beautiful. I believe you can't beat a Sony for the rich colors. We set the setup up our selves including connecting to the internet and through our home entertainment system with no issues whatsoever.  This included movies on demand on Amazon as well as our Sony blu ray player. Would highly recommend this TV and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Sherlock Holmes "Jaycee"
Reviews.Content: After a few weeks of use I can honestly say I love this television.  The picture is excellent, it is easy to use, it automatically switches sound between its own speakers and the surround sound when it is on.  It even looks good when it is off!No negatives at all.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV, if you can get it for the right price
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy this TV as they are beginning to clear our 2012 models for 2013, and believe it is an amazing deal if you can get in under $1500.  It flawlessly works with my DLNA server via the built-in wireless, with no buffering or lag issues.  The picture does need to be dialed-in after plugging it in, but anyone who has owned a Sony TV in the past will be comfortable with the options (not quite as robust as a Samsung, but you can still get fairly deep black levels, and Sony's color accuracy always seems better to me than Samsung's).

Reviews.Title: 3D and all you need
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a while now and so far it's operated as I had hoped it wood. Even though I have A TiVo that the TV doesn't need because it's a Smart TV. It works great with the TiVo and I have all I need,

Reviews.Title: Great tv.
Reviews.Author: Michael Hinerman
Reviews.Content: I am still waiting for the HD box from cable company but the improvement over the old tv that it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: WOTRTH EVERY PENNIES
Reviews.Author: A. LONG
Reviews.Content: amazing 3D pictures,Much better colors than Samsung, got A Samsung 7500 , decided to returned, replaced with this one, Very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Features, quality for the price
Reviews.Author: AWGamer11
Reviews.Content: - LED, 240hz, 3D, internet TV, Netflix, lot of good features for the price level. Clearly discounted based on MSRP from sonys website, whether they actually ever sold at full MSRP, I'm not sure.- Good quality picture from this TV connected to HDTV, haven't tried blu ray yet. My XBR is a little bit sharper, but it also cost me a lot more a few years ago, and its smaller by far.- Decent amount HDMI inputs, optical audio out, basically what you would expect at this price level- My advice before buying any TV, especially Sony, is to GO TO SONY'S WEBSITE, and do your comparisons and research there. Its much easier to research and compare, then come back to Amazon when you know what you want and type in the model number. This way you know what the most current models are, specs, etc.- Delivery was from a freight carrier, not UPS or Fedex, we did pre scheduled delivery at checkout, and they sent me a couple confirmation emails, and delivered the TV on the expected day a week later.- Overall pleased with the experience from Amazon, being my first big screen TV from them.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture / Terrible WiFi
Reviews.Author: johnbriggs
Reviews.Content: Get this TV for the amazing picture quality and features that Sony is famous for, but you will want to connect this directly to the network because the WiFi is so slow and unreliable with this set that you will hate it.  After I connected directly to the home Internet connection, the whole Sony experience went from extremely painful to pure viewing pleasure.  If you don't need the WiFi features, then you will be just fine.  But I purchased this to enjoy Amazon and Netflix streaming, no more expensive cable TV,

Reviews.Title: Great TV but a bit pricey
Reviews.Author: kashman
Reviews.Content: Sony has always been known to make great TV's. Market research shows it lagging behind Samsung. I am completely satisfied with this TV in terms of performance, design and quality. However I do feel it is overpriced by at least 300-400 dollars. Internet Features are not great and WiFi performance is poor. Hopefully the next release of Sony firmware will address this issue.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL55HX750 55 inch
Reviews.Author: sk
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and comparison, final choices was between Sony and Samsung, Sony was little bit more expensive, but since I always buy Sony and I did not want any hassle with return I decided to go with Sony. I should say that I may have been happy with Samsung too. Very easy set up, wireless very good, picture quality excellent as it should be.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Eugene Botelho
Reviews.Content: It cost less money than the same model at Best Buy and other stores.  So far I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: W from Chicago Metro
Reviews.Content: This TV is light, easy to set up and has a great picture.  I have not used the 3D yet, but I have watched sd, hd, dvd and blu-ray and they all show well.  I have a sound bar so I can't say anything about the sound.

Reviews.Title: SIMPLY AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: McKie Jr
Reviews.Content: I now have the best TV in the family, and I come from a big family. People see this TV and go "look honey at this TV" I got it in time for the Master's, you can actually see the shadow under the golf ball as it comes down, you can see the expressions of people in the crowd.  The skin tone is  life like. The 240hz makes it perfect for anything with motion, NASCAR, Football. You can't go wrong with this one, I love it!

Reviews.Title: Love the TV
Reviews.Author: Tomcat77
Reviews.Content: My concern was that this TV was going to be in my sunroom. The room is very bright in the day time. Absolutely no problem.

Reviews.Title: Poor menu takes horribly long
Reviews.Author: Mario V.
Reviews.Content: Sorry guys, but apart from the display being one of the best on the market, I have to say that it takes forever to add your programs to your favourits and then scroll to see them. Not the best experience and you fall asleep during handling... As I said, I like the display though. Sent it back and got a Samsung ;)

Reviews.Title: 3 good years then "poof"
Reviews.Author: K Tarnow
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV from Amazon 3.5 years ago.  Professionally installed with a beautiful picture and reliable performance until 2 months ago when vertical lines began to show on the screen.  The intermittent burn out of the picture has progressed to a constant "plaid" set of lines on the screen.  LCD Panel failure which will cost a fortune to repair.  Very disappointed that such an expensive, top of line Sony TV fails in only 3 years.

Reviews.Title: Great~~
Reviews.Author: KENG JU LIN
Reviews.Content: After received till now. Everything works great. The only thing which I hope is that it can support other language beside English. I used its "Internet content" to watch Youtube video. The letters which are not English all become square.

Reviews.Title: Poor Audio
Reviews.Author: R. Watkins
Reviews.Content: The picture is good, but the audio is very tinny and lacks any bass.  It's on par with cell-phone audio.  Count on getting a sound bar or some form of external speakers if you want decent audio.

Reviews.Title: Great deal!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ciprian Dan "Mr."
Reviews.Content: Great deal!!!!!!! Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!!!Great deal!!!!!! Love it it works as expected. Keep it up folks!
